comment.author: 45674201@N00
comment._content: It looks like the train was Climax Locomotive no. 239, which was built in 1900 and ordered by Phoenix Logging Co. in Potlatch, Washington. En route it was diverted to Simpson Logging Co. in Shelton, Washington. It was damaged in a fire c. 1903 and sold to Columbia & Nehalem Valley Railroad No. 1 in Columbia City, Oregon. In 1906 it was in Columbia City at Peninsula Lumber Co. and in 1916 it was at Klamath Logging & Timber Co. in Odessa, Oregon. Information from: Climax's website.
